item.title: Big branch going out left towards park, 22nd March
item.description:
In front of 15 and 14 jupiter way , branch growing out and across pavement , needs cutting as could be dangerous

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sent to Gloucestershire County Council less than a minute later. FixMyStreet ref: 5719747. Photo of this report At the Junction between Guinevere Road and Tennyson Road close to Nº 39 Tennyson - this has been reported as being’fixed’ and clearly only a holding action has been taken leaving sharp metal that if fallen against would cause potential injury. Please revisit and complete the remediation. Thank you, 22nd March
item.description:
Sent to Gloucestershire County Council less than a minute later. FixMyStreet ref: 5719747. Photo of this report At the Junction between Guinevere Road and Tennyson Road close to Nº 39 Tennyson - this has not been fixed and exposed sharp metal has been left which if fallen onto has potential for injury. Please return to fully remediate the communal fencing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Guinevere Road, St Mark's, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Junction box not repainted, 22nd March
item.description:
We have had resurfacing works on barnwood road off of insley gardens and the white lines have been repainted but not the yellow junction box meaning that it is very difficult to get onto barnwood road coming from insley gardens. Almost impossible at busy times
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnwood Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

what3words: ///weddings.awards.masterful The location is the on lane running between Cockleford and Cowley, as you pass Cowley Manor parkland. There are a number running along the lane. Please also find an image of the pot taken at the time on 14/03/2024.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge “square” shaped pot hole where road has sunk after Wales & West didn’t repair the road after their work, 22nd March
item.description:
Outside St Andrews Church in Churchdown. Wales & west have completed their work & left 1 area with an awful repair. The area has badly sunken tarmac & is very deep. Can’t avoid driving over it. Extremely deep & dangerous, will damage vehicles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two Trench Type Potholes, 22nd March
item.description:
Located at the junction of Sandford Road and College Lawn. Large trench type pothole on either side of a previous repair carried out earlier this year. This is creating a large amount of gravel as the tarmac deteriorates creating a hazard to motorists due to potential windscreen damage. These trench potholes are across the exit of Keynsham road creating severe lurching to vehicles when exiting on to Sandford Road. This junction is regularly used by fire engines from the local station.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandford Road, Tivoli, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
